definitions.definition: a small light that is held in the hand and usually gets its power from batteries:
examples: She flashed/shone the torch into the dark room.

definitions.definition: a thick stick with material that burns tied to the top of it, used to give light:
used as a symbol of a political movement or idea that has an important positive influence:
examples: She promised that the party would carry the torch of progressivism into the next decade.

definitions.definition: to burn a building or other large thing, intentionally and usually illegally:
examples: They smashed a side door to get in and then torched the warehouse when they had taken what they wanted.
